example.text: New York’s Congestion Tax will kill jobs, it will kill small businesses, & it will drain pocketbooks. Thanks to National Limousine Association [[user]] for having me as we work together to put an end to the MTA’s ridiculous $23-a-day tax on hardworking commuters. [[url]]

This week, I introduced my bipartisan Invest to Protect Act to make critical investments in local law enforcement — in training, recruitment and retention, and in mental health to protect our officers, families, and communities.

The hardworking men and women of [[user]] are key to keeping our nation’s infrastructure safe (and pothole free!). Glad we could meet in DC to continue the important work of quickly clawing back investments for Jersey’s roads, bridges, and infrastructure projects. [[url]]

I’m also continuing to fight against New York and the MTA’s anti-environment, cash-grabbing $23-a-day Congestion Tax plan. They announced that they plan to make small changes to their plan, but it’s nothing more than trying to put lipstick on a pig.

As I continue the critical work of strengthening the ? ?-? ?relationship and ensuring it remains bipartisan and durable, it was great to meet with former Israeli Prime Minister [[user]]. I am grateful for his insight and knowledge. [[url]]

As I continue the critical work of strengthening the ? ?-? ?relationship and ensuring it remains bipartisan and durable, it was great to meet with former Israeli Prime Minister [[user]]. I am grateful for his insight and knowledge. [[url]]

I’m leading the bipartisan Hamas International Financing Prevention Act with [[user]] to impose sanctions on anyone who assists Hamas, PIJ, or their affiliates. We need to isolate and punish terrorists by cutting off their financial resources at the source.
